newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: China postpones Dutch trade mission over rights.
newsitem.headline: China postpones Dutch trade mission over rights.

text.p: China has postponed a Dutch trade mission scheduled for June because of the Netherlands' support for a U.N. resolution critical of its human rights record, the Dutch Economic Affairs ministry said on Tuesday.

The Netherlands, with Denmark, the United States and 12 other countries, is co-sponsoring a resolution criticising China's human rights record. China has warned that relations with these countries will be affected.
"This Chinese step must be linked to the role that the Netherlands...has played in drawing attention to human rights in China at the U.N. Human Rights Commission in Geneva," the ministry said.
The mission would have taken place from June 7 to 14 under leadership of Economic Affairs Minister Hans Wijers.

"The Netherlands government has learned of this Chinese step with disappointment," the ministry said. "The government of the Netherlands will continue to pursue the further development of political and economic relations with China."
"(Our) relations have until now appeared strong enough to raise even as sensitive a subject as human rights in all openness and through all available channels."
